alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Leavenworth; Wyandotte (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 9:09PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wyandotte, southern Leavenworth and northwestern Johnson Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 908 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eudora, or 8 miles west of De Soto, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Overland Park, Shawnee, Lenexa, Merriam, Mission, Bonner Springs, De Soto, Tonganoxie, Basehor, Edwardsville, Lake Quivira, Kansas City Kansas, Kansas City, Linwood, Roeland Park, Reno, Wolcott, Pomeroy, Holliday and Clearview City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 410 and 422. Interstate 35 in Kansas between mile markers 230 and 234. Interstate 635 between mile markers 0 and 8. Interstate 435 between mile markers 6 and 20. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 206 and 226. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas...and west central Missouri.
